summary:
As an electrical engineer, I have always been fascinated by the intricate workings of the world and especially the technology part of it.  However, my love for storytelling has led me to explore photography as a means of capturing and sharing the stories around me. I specialise in landscape photography using my camera as a tool to capture the world around me and tell compelling stories through images.

Beyond my technical expertise, my passion for photography has taught me the importance of creativity, precision, and attention to detail. In addition to my photography work, I also maintain a blog where I share my work and the story behind the captures from my perspective.

As an electrical engineer and photographer, I bring a unique perspective to my work, always striving to find innovative solutions and tell compelling stories. Whether I'm behind the camera or trying to solve complex problems, I'm always pushing the boundaries of what's possible, finding new ways to communicate and always up for a new challenge in uncharted territories. 

So if you're interested in discussing photography, engineering, or anything in between, I'm always ready to have a conversation.

projects.title: Optimal Integration of Network Flexibility and Asset Intelligence (ORKEST)
projects.description:
• Partnering with a regional grid operator, knowledge institutes and other key stakeholders.
• Played a significant role with colleagues from the company in formulating roadmaps to achieve the engineering and operational objectives.
• Developed innovative tools during my tenure at Phase to Phase BV so far, which are planned to be used strategically over the course of the project to achieve the set goals.

projects.title: Built Environment Electrification (Go-E)
projects.description:
• Successfully collaborated with experts from regional grid operators, technology providers, knowledge institutions and consultants.
• Leveraged the collective expertise of colleagues from Phase to Phase BV to implement advanced network calculations to predict and solve congestion scenarios at the household level, taking into account Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) penetration.
• Demonstrated skills by improving existing tools in the company’s products to optimise and facilitate efficient calculation strategy for congestion management.
• Co-ordinated with stakeholders in regular progress meetings keeping track of updates and forming a strategy to achieve the project goals

publications.name: Validation of Gaussian Mixture LV Load  Models based on MV/LV Transformer Stations  Measurements
publications.publisher: Congres International des Réseaux Electriques de Distribution (CIRED)

publications.name: State Estimation in Medium Voltage Distribution Networks using Pseudo Measurements
publications.publisher: Conseil International des Grands Réseaux Electriques (CIGRE)

publications.name: State Estimation in Medium Voltage Distribution Networks
Dynamic State Estimation of Synchronous Generator Rotor Angle Using PMU and EKF Under Stressed Conditions
Real-time implementation of phasor measurement unit using NI CompactRIO
publications.publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

profile_positions.description:
Phase to Phase (subsidiary of Technolution BV) develops software for calculating electricity grids. Phase to Phase combines current knowledge in the field of mathematics, physics and computer science in innovative solutions. 
 
My activities at Phase to Phase include and not limited to:
• Work on the Research & Development end of the company which also includes consulting from time to time.
• Collaborating with DSO's and industries from the Netherlands to bridge the gap between the theoretical and practical world. 
• Involved in consortium projects like Go-E and ORKEST with multiple stakeholders from the industry as well as universities. 
• Represent the company and the work done in international conferences as well as universities. 
• Make tutorials for newly developed features and modules.
• Lead the development of a few features in the cloud environment. 
• Development of algorithms for power system computations. Few of them include:

- Data driven load flow (State Estimation) module in Vision Network Analysis (collaboration) 
- Bottom up approach in Gaia LV Network Design and Vision Cloud Solution
- Improvement of Gaussian Mixture model used for load behavior generation at household level
profile_positions.title: Scientific Engineer/Researcher

profile_positions.description: Worked towards the initial implementation of the work done in my masters to the softwares of Phase to Phase with the idea of developing a module for industrial use and aid in energy transition as well as network congestion.
profile_positions.title: Working Student

profile_positions.description:
During my master thesis project at TU Delft, I collaborated with Phase to Phase and worked on the topic of State Estimation in Medium Voltage Distribution Networks. The collaboration with the university and industry turned out to be very fruitful considering the theoretical aspects could be intertwined with the industry and in practical applications.

The end product of this thesis also resulted in the publication of a paper in CIGRE 2022 biannual session in Paris.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Young Energy Specialists and Development Co-operation (YES-DC), founded in October 1994 is an association comprised of students and young professionals interested or working in the field of energy. YES-DC organises various sessions throughout the year as a means to create a network and to facilitate the exchange of information and experiences.

Notable achievements during my term include:
• Formulated a strategic recovery plan for the organisation post the COVID-19 pandemic, to re-establish its importance and continued growth.
• Planned the annual budget successfully, which resulted in cost savings and optimal financial spending.
• Diligently kept track of finances throughout the year, in order to ensure transparency within the community.
profile_positions.title: Board Treasurer

profile_positions.description:
ENTER's professionals work with partners and customers on a project basis.

• Worked for Phase to Phase BV as a Researcher/Scientific Engineer through ENTER BV for 6 months. 
• Started working directly for Phase to Phase upon completion of contract at ENTER BV.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Software and Data Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As a leading research institution, TU Delft has formulated its stance on sustainability in a clear manner.  The research committee aligns and integrates all sustainability-related knowledge and accomplishments, which naturally can be a challenge for an organization as large and diverse as TU Delft. 

As part of the committee, few of the notable achievements during my term include:
• Aligned the team with a set of concrete goals, to ensure efficiency and attain the goals.
• Ensured that there is streamlined collaboration in the team by tracking and organizing content from the team members.
• Proactively led the team to engage with other relevant parties within the university to gather vital information on carbon footprint reduction strategies and waste management.
• Proposed actionable innovative solutions along with the team and at the end released an annual report with sustainable practices structured on four pillars of sustainability, namely Research, Education, Operations and Social Engagement.
profile_positions.title: Chairperson, Research Committee

profile_positions.description:
The ‘Sterkstroomdispuut der Electrotechnische Vereeniging’ (SSD) was founded in 1964 as a chapter of Electrotechnische Vereeniging (ETV). It is the student association for Master students pursuing Electrical Power Engineering.

Notable achievements include:
• Ensured a smooth transition to online modes of networking and events to ensure continued engagement and learning opportunities for students, amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
• Managed the board’s finances ensuring financial stability and optimal resource management.
• Represented the students of electrical power engineering branch in the university as well as industrial setting to provide opportunity and exposure to students.
profile_positions.title: Board Member/Treasurer

company.name: SPARK ( Summer Internship at IIT Roorkee ), IITR

profile_positions.company: SPARK ( Summer Internship at IIT Roorkee ), IITR
profile_positions.description:
IIT Roorkee offers institute-funded  and project-funded summer internships under the SPARK program. T  Out of more than 3000 applicants for the programme in 2018, I was one of the 100 people selected that year for the pilot batch of the SPARK internship programme.

As part of the programme, notable achievements include:
• Worked on an innovative design and implementation of a novel converter configuration for Electric Vehicle Applications.
• Won the best poster award.
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Intern at Hydro Power Simulation Laboratory

profile_positions.description:
When enrolled at National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli I extensively worked at the Power Systems and Smart Grid Lab. Power system and smart grid research lab was established in 2013 by financial assistance from the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India and NIT Trichy. The objective is to enhance the R&D work in Power system as well as smart grids.

One of the first projected I worked on is as an intern here

• Worked on the implementation of phasor measurement units in a power system.
• The research work done during this period has been presented in an IEEE conference on "Advances in Electrical Technology in Green Energy" in Coimbatore.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Currents is the annual technical symposium of the department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, NIT Trichy and attracts participation from prestigious institutions from around the country. I was a part of two committees, the Marketing team and the Workshop team. My responsibilities included:

• Conducted multiple technical workshops for a crowd of over 600 and arranging the kits required.
• Co-ordinated the smooth running of the workshops to avoid and overcome any last minute glitches to make the symposium a success.
• Actively sought sponsers and interested parties in the months leading to the symposium
profile_positions.title: Workshops / Marketing Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Participated in a drive to clean the campus of NIT Tiruchirappalli and the locality around it.
• Planted samplings all around the campus area to promote greenery.
